name: equidistant
content:

Places or points that are equidistant have equal distances between them. : Along the avenue, all the trees were of the same height and were equidistant. He checked the other two meters, positioned at equidistant points around the edge of the building. Australia is roughly equidistant from Africa and South America. Milton Keynes is equidistant between Birmingham and London.
More examplesFewer examplesThe paintings are placed equidistant from each other along the gallery wall.There were clearly identifiable equidistant markings along the length of the tube.Any three hues that are equidistant on the colour wheel comprise a triadic colour scheme.
